result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew N. Bozicevich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct - County/Municipality [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.

Supervision fees
DNA Sample
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew N. Bozicevich

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Phone call from de - he has lost his debit card and will be in to make payment when he receives new one in 7-10 days.
Notified Nicole - made payment and payment plan set up
TC with Deft, he states he does not have the full payment at this time. Court okays payment of $310 to quash warrant and establish a payment plan of $50 per MO.
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

8:37 am Defendant Andrew N. Bozicevich in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cm107, 16cm210 and 16cm299. Schiek recites agreement. State moves to amend Count 1 in 16cm107 to ordinance disorderly conduct - Granted. State moves to dismiss 16cm210 and 16cm299 - Granted. Plea Questionnaire and Victim Impact Statement filed. Defendant enters guilty plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Burns/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence 
Count 1 - Court imposes fine of $263.50
Count 2 
WHS/POP - 12 months
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
No intoxicants; no taverns
AODA Assessment and follow-through
Restitution - $2,084.82 plus $208.48 for a total of $2,293.30
Any other conditions/counselling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Burns statement to removal of items of personal property left at residence - there is a restraining order in addition to this case - Court statement - Schiek statement-will speak with victim and attempt resolution.
Adj. 9:12 a.m.  Review hearing scheduled for October 3, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

1:29 p.m. Defendant Andrew N. Bozicevich in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cm107 and 16cm210 - Burns states has not reached resolution - requests jury trial in 16cm107. Counsel to be available at 8:15 a.m. in chambers. Court to be put on notice before noon June 27, 2016 if matter has been settled to avoid imposition of jury costs. Burns motion to modify bond to allow defendant to attend school event with child as long as no contact remains with victim. Court clarifies no contact provision but no contact provision remains--bond conditions not modified. Bail continued. Adj. 1:31 p.m.  Jury trial scheduled for June 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
No contact with Cynthia Alsteen, No intoxicants, No taverns

Defendant Andrew N. Bozicevich in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
8:32
Schiek statement to motion to modify bond - Burns statement to bond - Bloom statement - court adds no intoxicants, no taverns as further conditions of bond -

1:29 p.m. Defendant Andrew N. Bozicevich in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea. Burns/Bednar statement to bond. Court modifies bond to signature bond. Adj. 1:33 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
